definition: embarrassing/dull/unsatisfactory
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
interesting/to interest
to invite a snub/to court a rebuff

sentences.english: Feeling he was not wanted, he walked away looking embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 他覺得沒趣，只好訕訕地走開了。

sentences.english: A: The shows are dull and they’re too many advertisements.
sentences.chinese: 這些節目都很沒趣，而且廣告太多了。

sentences.english: Studies the intelligent spot, do not have a joke backfire.
sentences.chinese: 學聰明點吧，不要自討沒趣。

sentences.english: No-one in their right mind can claim that Chelsea were boring.
sentences.chinese: 腦筋正常的人是不會說切爾西很沒趣的。

sentences.english: The shows are dull and they're too many advertisements.
sentences.chinese: 這些節目都很沒趣，而且廣告太多了。

sentences.english: Can I please go to work and humiliate myself now?
sentences.chinese: 我能去上班順便自討沒趣了嗎？

sentences.english: I went to the General office, and ate dirt.
sentences.chinese: 我到總辦事處去，結果自討沒趣。

sentences.english: You will be disselected to the result.
sentences.chinese: 這個結果將會使你沒趣。

sentences.english: This is the least interesting book I've ever read.
sentences.chinese: 這是我所讀過的最沒趣的書。

sentences.english: If that person can't figure out who are you, aren't you just asking for trouble?
sentences.chinese: 要是人家想不出或猜不着你是誰，豈非自討沒趣？

sentences.english: She know how to score off people who ask difficult question.
sentences.chinese: 她很會讓那些給她出難題的人自討沒趣。

sentences.english: He looked without much interest at the unmoving figures all around him.
sentences.chinese: 他沒趣地打量着自己周圍的一動不動的蠟像。

sentences.english: One of my favourite lines is that "normal is boring".
sentences.chinese: 用我最喜歡的一句話來形容，“正常是最沒趣的”。

definition: to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
snobbish
to make a big fuss over a minor issue (idiom)
to have no strength/to feel weak/exhausted/feeling listless/boring/of no interest
to burst out laughing/to laugh
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to preach
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
all smiles/smiling mischievously or ingratiatingly
